Combine two Wonde raw data lists element-wise

Source: R/utils.R
combine_raw_data.Rd

Merges two lists of raw Wonde school datasets (a and b) into a single combined list. This is typically used to append newly retrieved school data (e.g., additional Wonde API extracts) to an existing dataset that was pulled earlier.

Each element of list b is added to list a using its name as the key. If a name already exists in a, it will be overwritten by the corresponding element from b.

Usage

combine_raw_data(a, b)

Arguments

a

A named list of Wonde raw datasets, usually the original data pulled via get_primary_school_student_data() or get_secondary_school_student_data().

b

A second named list of Wonde raw datasets to be appended or merged into a.

Value

A single combined list containing all elements from both a and b. The resulting structure is suitable for downstream processing functions such as extract_class_list() or summarise_school_data().

Details

This function is commonly used when some schools are pulled from the Wonde API at a later time (for example, schools missing from the original retrieval). Instead of re-pulling all data, you can append the new raw extracts directly using this helper.

The combination is done by name: each element in b is added to a under its existing name (usually the Wonde school ID). If duplicate names are present, entries from b will overwrite those in a.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Original Wonde data
raw_data_1 <- get_secondary_school_student_data(school_ids = c("A100001", "A100002"))

# Later, new schools become available
raw_data_2 <- get_secondary_school_student_data(school_ids = c("A100003", "A100004"))

# Combine both into one object
combined_raw <- combine_raw_data(raw_data_1, raw_data_2)

# The result can then be used in extract_class_list()
class_list <- extract_class_list(WondeData = combined_raw, ...)
} # }
